key_risks: Significant exposure to the commercial real estate sector
High sensitivity to interest rate changes
Ongoing regulatory scrutiny and compliance costs
Intense competitive pressures in the Florida banking market
controversies: Mixed customer reviews with an average rating of 2.7 out of 5 stars
social_issues: Customer service issues and improper fees
governance_issues: Regulatory oversight from OCC, FDIC, and the Federal Reserve
Need for improved customer service and fee transparency

sources.title: BankUnited, Inc. Reports 2023 Results
sources.snippet: Our commercial real estate exposure is modest. Commercial real estate loans totaled 23.6% of loans at December 31, 2023 , representing 169% of the Bank's total risk based capital. At December 31, 2023 , the weighted average LTV of the CRE portfolio was 56.0% and the weighted average DSCR was 1.80. 58% of the portfolio was secured by collateral

sources.snippet: BankUnited, Inc. is a bank holding company of BankUnited (the Bank). sources.title: Potential fraud drives charge-offs at BankUnited
sources.snippet: CFO Leslie Lunak said the pool of loans BankUnited categorized as "special mention" fell $386 million in the third quarter, but "substandard" increased by $816 million, including loans that worsened from special mention to substandard. Much of the net increase was driven by commercial real estate loans backed by hotels and retail properties.
